intro: Lomandra cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical lomandra, is a perennial evergreen herb native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and compact, cylindrical flowering heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, dark green leaves that are arranged in a rosette. Its flowers, which are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, appear in late spring to early summer. Lomandra cylindrica is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments.
